abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project would include:
            US$40 million to finance imports of raw materials,
            intermediate products and capital equipment which will be
            associated with the higher economic growth rate contemplated
            under the Government development program; counterpart funds
            from import financing to be used to support public
            investment program and working capital needs of export
            enterprises; (ii) US$20 million to finance enterprises
            producing non-traditional exports by means of sub-loans made
            through Banco de la Republica and financial intermediaries
            at Bank's interest rate plus one-half of one percent to
            Banco de la Republica for administrative costs, plus 3
            percent to financial intermediaries, plus 8-1/4 percent to
            cover exchange risk assumed by Banco de la Republic.
